title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A young boy discovers he is a wizard and attends a magical school called Hogwarts.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A hobbit embarks on a journey to recover treasure guarded by a dragon.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A young girl grows up in the South during the Great Depression and learns about racial injustice.

author: George Orwell
description: A totalitarian government watches every citizen's move and manipulates the truth.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A troubled teenager recounts his life experiences in a cynical and detached way.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A young man becomes infatuated with the mysterious millionaire Gatsby and his ill-fated love story.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A group of individuals must destroy a powerful ring to save Middle-earth from an evil lord.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: An art historian and a cryptologist solve a series of puzzles leading to a centuries-old secret.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A spirited young woman navigates issues of love, marriage, and society in Regency-era England.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a post-apocalyptic society, young people are forced to participate in a deadly televised competition.
